text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

I strive to honor my
family's roots in Arkansas.

We have maintained
our family farm

through multiple generations,
and fiercely protected it

against the systemic racism that
has led to so much Black farmer
land loss.

I not only want people to think
about where their food comes

from, but also
about the hands that

collected the food, the
conditions that they labored

under, and whether they
were compensated fairly.

We are increasingly talking
about food as medicine.

With that in mind,
I think we need

to have more momentum
towards seeing access

to nutritious, affordable
food as a right rather
than a privilege.

Because of this,
my life's purpose

is to elevate the voices
of agricultural workers,

to empower consumers to
hold businesses accountable,

and to enter
corporate boardrooms

to realize my vision for more
inclusivity in the food supply
chain.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
